data.title: Revisiting the PSP Go, more than 10 years later...
data.meta_description: So, my kids were playing Astro‚Äôs Playroom the other day, and when they unlocked the PSP Go, I told them ‚ÄúWe have this thing at home, let me fetch it‚Äù. Disclaimer: this is...
data.text:
So, my kids were playing Astro‚Äôs Playroom the other day, and when they unlocked the PSP Go, I told them ‚ÄúWe have this thing at home, let me fetch it‚Äù.

Disclaimer: this is a copy of a Twitter thread I published back in March 2022. I‚Äôm hoping publishing it here will get it some visibility for those of you who don‚Äôt follow me on Twitter.

I haven‚Äôt turned my PSP Go on in years, possibly a decade. Let‚Äôs have a look!

Here it is! (I‚Äôm cheating, it was very dirty, I had to clean it up with alcohol before taking this picture. I almost threw up when I saw the color of the buttons)

Of course, after a decade in a closet, the PSP won‚Äôt turn on. It took me a while to find the charger‚Ä¶ I think that‚Äôs the right one?

It looks like it‚Äôs charging! That‚Äôs a miracle in itself. Let it sit for a few hours then come back. Fingers crossed!

And the PSP Go still works after a decade of inactivity, ladies and gentlemen! I haven‚Äôt touched it in so long, I am excited to discover what‚Äôs on it, as I don‚Äôt remember at all.

It‚Äôs running on firmware 6.60‚Ä¶

Some psp games related to usermode exploit research in there. Uno, Patapon, Hot Shots Golf in particular were used as entry points for PSP/Vita hacks:

Happy new year! PSP Game UNO vulnerability revealed by Frostegater, port of CEF To Vita 2.02 incoming. (2012)

Way to keep a secret malloxis (2010)

HBL Released for 6.30/6.31 (2010)

Afraid to click the PRO CIPL Flasher as I don‚Äôt clearly remember what it does. I decide to leave it for now

Some homebrew on the console: rrootage, Touhou Imitation Style, Adventure Game Studio,‚Ä¶ most releases seem to be around 2011 (as I said, haven‚Äôt touched it in a decade)

AGS Port by JJS: play hundreds of indie games on your PSP! (2011)

rRootage for PSP Download page

The list wouldn‚Äôt be complete without some emulation. The console has Snes9xTyl (SNES Emulator) installed.

Snes9xTyl Download page

And of course, my very own homebrew game, Wagic ( https://wololo.net/download/ ), which at this point was pretty much burned in on the internal flash‚Ä¶

Did you notice Killzone Liberation in my photo above? This game was given to PSP owners for free as a commercial gesture by PlayStation, after a very long downtime of the PSN back in 2011. Remember what caused that downtime?

Before I try to run homebrew, I‚Äôm having a quick look at what else is on the console. I have a bit of music in there‚Ä¶ the PSP was a great MP3 player! In an era where dedicated MP3 players were a thing, having a multi-purpose portable device was kind of new when the PS Launched

Remember these? You could watch TV (with the dedicated accessory) and subscribe to some comic ebook service on the PSP‚Ä¶at least in Japan

I enter the image folder, and‚Ä¶ crash! Some tiff image in there that the console doesn‚Äôt like‚Ä¶ Image lib vulnerabilities were a popular usermode entry point on the PSP. We didn‚Äôt have Webkit üôÇ

Let‚Äôs go back to homebrews. I haven‚Äôt run the 6.60 PRO exploit yet, so most homebrews refuse to start:

Rrootage is the exception. The homebrew was signed, meaning it behaves as a ‚Äúlegit‚Äù game and can run on an unhacked console. This signing technique was developed by hackers in 2011, following the discovery of critical PSP keys on the PS3.

Now running PSP Pro Custom Firmware. This will install the hack in RAM, deactivate the console‚Äôs security, & allow me to run unsigned software. PSP Pro was one of the most popular CFWs for the PSP, because it defeated almost all games anti-piracy measures.

My unsigned homebrews now run! As to why some homebrews were unsigned even though we knew how to sign them and run them without a hack: unsigned homebrews had benefits, for example they could use more RAM

That‚Äôs all! I hope you enjoyed. It was a nice trip down memory lane for me üôÇ

What do you remember from the PSP days? Share in the comments below!
